senses.sense_definition: Relating to a Lower Paleolithic industry of flint tool manufacture characterized by thick, irregular flakes and cores, originally discovered at Clacton-on-Sea.

examples.text: The museum exhibit features several <w>Clactonian</w> artifacts recovered from the river gravels.
Archaeologists identified a distinct <w>Clactonian</w> notch on the edge of the flint tool.

senses.sense_definition: Of, belonging to, or characteristic of the town of Clacton-on-Sea in England.

examples.text: The <w>Clactonian</w> coastline attracts many tourists during the warm summer months.
Local <w>Clactonian</w> businesses are working together to improve the town center.

senses.sense_definition: A member of the ancient culture or people associated with the Clactonian industry of tool making.

examples.text: Little is known about the daily lives of the <w>Clactonians</w> beyond the stone tools they left behind.
The <w>Clactonians</w> inhabited the region during a warm interglacial period.
